column4: any ideas anyone? http://pastebin.ca/1005742 i cant mount my NTFS drive... i atleast want read permission
did you follow the wiki ubotu told you?, you can read mount it using this: sudo mount -o uid=your_user /dev/hda1 /mountpoint/
that uses the kernel driver and youll be able to read without problems, ntfs3g is safer, you should check the wiki
its ubottu someone changed the name, it is the bot
well, then follow the instructions there, you have 2 choices
sry I can't be of more help
